title: Hatchy
author: Hatchy
content: The issue of poverty that has surrounded West Africa is no longer a news, as the government of these countries has failed their people. Most especially in Nigeria, where inflation matters keep getting worse years after years. The idea of fighting poverty and hunger is no longer the responsibility of the Nigeria government, as citizens have given up on them a long time ago.Was it always like this ?, I would say no because as far as I can remember, the government that left power in 2015 didn't leave such mess, although times were tough as always. but the government before that was even far better than the one that left in 2015. Without being told, I know that this situation is getting worse and as time goes on, we might as well see even more hardship in Nigeria.About two days ago, I sat down to watch TV and coincidentally, I turned to ad jazeera where news of illegal immigrants was being broadcasted. It saddens me when I heard that over 118K illegal immigrants from Africa has entered Italy since January this year till this moment.The most frustrating part was that the Italian government has declared that they can no longer accommodate illegal immigrants in their country.https://www.aljazeera.com/amp/program/inside-story/2023/9/14/has-italys-approach-to-migration-failedThis shows how terrible the whole situation has become, Knowing fully well that so many Nigerians, including some of us reading this post would love to leave this country with any given opportunity.(japa).Though, I won't blame the Italian government for taking such action, they should also be able to reduce over population unlike the one that has affected Nigeria and other Africa countries.Even with the current hardship, something still surprises me among some Nigerians, most especially the youths that has made the right decision for themselves. The evolution of technology has become their source of income, as they've capitalized fully on the potentials of the internet. The youths can no longer sit and wait for the government, because they no longer care about our future.All they care about is their political title and themselves. with this, I will say that the government is being selfish. These whole issue has made the youth to utilize the power of the internet and are making the best out of it.The internet which is basically categories into three webs which are web 1.0, 2.0 and the recent 3.0 have being able to provide few Nigerians with the financial freedom they need. Web 3.0 which is a complete package of Blockchain technology, Artificial intelligence, Cryptocurrency, etc is beginning to take shape in our world today.This youth have fully taken advantage on the benefits of the internet and provide job opportunities for themselves. You must be wondering what kind of jobs are they ?, They are...Cryptocurrency (Trading)Forex TradingContent Creation (blogging, video,etc)AnimationsProgrammingFrom the list above, we literally don't need any physical tutor to learn any of these, because YouTube is the current best tutor around the world. these skills can generate an average Nigeria youth at least something to help take care of his daily needs.We no longer need to wait for the government for a job, because there isn't any. I remembered sometimes ago, on tv where the government were making fund of the poor. This doesn't sounds well right because the government of a country is supposed to provide for it's people no matter what and eradicate poverty. instead they sit up there and laugh at us.If you are living in Nigeria, and you know for sure that a job isn't secured for you, it is advisable that you get one of this digital skills or else, hunger fit destroy your life. even at getting a job, you can still minize time and also engage in some of these web3 jobs because they will actually act as a means of earning extra. we shouldn't forget that you are not supposed to have 1 source of income in a country like Nigeria where everything is on a hike. let's all endeavour to participate in these job opportunities. we should Make a wise decision now and secure our future.

comments.author: Abu-Naim
comments.body: This content explained almost every issue that most of our youths face in this country; I no longer rely on the government in this country because the small amount of money I made two weeks ago through a signature campaign convinced me that waiting for the government to provide us with jobs is a waste of time; it is better we wake up and do something better for ourselves and our families.The Internet has made everything easy for us now, because if we take a look at graduates in the labor market, we will understand how important this forum and other Web 3 jobs out there are to providing opportunities for Nigerians. If all of us depend on the government and fail to go to the internet and look for something to do, then by now, what to eat will be very hard for the common man because our leaders are selfish and are not ready to help us.

comments.author: Promocodeudo
comments.body: There are opportunities in Nigeria, but the setback to some people is getting the information itself, not everyone has the information, just imagine what life would have been for many Nigerian youths without the Bitcoin Talk forum, this might sound strange but that's the truth, this forum has impacted in many peoples life by educating them more about Bitcoin and cryptocurrency in general but we can not dispute the monetary benefit attached as a result of individual contribution to this forum,the threads created here, has been helpful to many of us, that go through them, these threads has help me to be careful the way I do things in real life.The major obstacle for youths and advanced youths out there is the connection from the right people and the internet service itself is also a problem, we should know that it is not everyone that's residing or can afford the rent in the urban area, so how will this set of persons cope, though our government has failed us, we too as individuals having this helpful piece of information should not hold it from our friends, brothers, sisters in other to keep the ground running, Nigeria will be great again if we the youths can do our part.

Having more than one source of income is the best and all Nigerians are now keying into that already.

comments.author: iBaba
comments.body: Quote from: Asiska02 on September 18, 2023, 09:25:35 AMSometimes I feel the hardship some Nigerians are facing makes them know their true potential as a person. If someone is always in their comfort zone, they don’t explore to see more skills they can be able to render themselves with. Although, this till comes with the availability of resources to carry this out. Life in general is very hard but only the truly committed and dedicated one always find a way out.The most scary part of staying in your comfort zone is that it makes you overly stagnant in growth and learning new things. It is the worst part of a person particularly when you are in a young age. Comfort zone attracts many bad habits including procrastination and mental loneliness. The brain has been designed to accommodate active events to stay charged and active. I've experienced all of these in the past and all I can say is that we should fight our comfort zones, either by exiting or by engaging in other self-development skills and courses. Like it is said that in every sickness, there's a medicine.  Alongside the effects, I was able to learn self-development courses and skills that are helpful today.QuoteHaving one source of income in Nigeria is not advisable. Even the civil servants and politicians don’t just depend on their basic salary, most of them have other businesses and establishments that is earning them more money. Civil servants will be retired after 35 years in service, politicians will also leave their positions after their tenure has ended. Without a continuous good source of income, I think this people will either return back to the way they were before getting this jobs or their source of income will reduce drastically to some unbearable minimum amount. Having more than one source of income is the best and all Nigerians are now keying into that already.And making the better use of the comfort zone is even better. Because for Naija, I doubt if them get single person wey never enter comfort zone before, but like we dey talk, side hustle really dey important for life. In fact, whether you work or not. Having multiple streams of income is the best thing that can ever happen to a man. For me, the standard is at least four streams of income. Like stated in the Bible, there are four rivers of paradise that flows from the garden of eden, so shall man never lack from four streams of income.

Like stated in the Bible, there are four rivers of paradise that flows from the garden of eden, so shall man never lack from four streams of income.There is a local saying that never put all your eggs in one basket because if you do when the basket falls all the eggs you have been saving for years will be broken as such sending you back to square one, there is also another saying that when you are trying to reach out a basket on the rooftop using a ladder that you shouldn't use the two hands to get it instead use only one hand so that the other hand will stand as a suspension were as it keeps you balance when you miss your steps.
